Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2008 08:24PM kiki wrote: Linda please hang in there.  Things will get better.  Be kind to yourself.  I will pray for you.  You will get through it.
Posts.Title: LinS returns..bilateral dble mastectomy 4-18-07 LinS LUVmy2girlZ

Posts.Content: Mar 31, 2008 05:46AM kiki wrote: Sable, please find yourself another PS.  I have just gone through an 8month ordeal with an uncaring PS (who has a severe God complex).  She made my life a living hell.  Keep looking until you find someone who makes you feel at ease.  You'll know when it's right.  Good luck.
Posts.Title: Bad PS visit made me reconsider reconstruction Sable Vz_mom

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2008 01:24PM kiki wrote: I'm so glad you wrote this.  I was diagnosed last year 4 months after my 40th birthday.  For about a year before that I was having night sweats and irregular periods.  I have always suspected that there was some connection between an hormonal imbalance and my cancer.  Have you read any studies about this.  I'm very interested.
Posts.Title: Is it true there are no symptoms other than breast changes? PeaceChild kiki

Posts.Content: Mar 5, 2008 12:50PM kiki wrote: Ok here is a question for those of you who have had your seromas drained.  What did the fluid look like?  I have had an ongoing issue with my tram flap recon breast.  Of course the side that had bc.  It got really swollen and finally burst open at the "seam" incision line.  My ps insists it is fat necrosis.  It has been draining for 4 months a dark yellowish liquid with small white clumps in it.  I finally go for an MRI on Friday to make sure it is fat necrosis.  But, I still don't know for sure!  Thanks for any insight.
Posts.Title: Anyone develop a seroma? Kimber 5yrsurvivor
